channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Remembering baseball writer Scott Miller
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Tyler Kepner of the New York Times about the life and legacy of baseball writer Scott Miller.

item.title: Reporter's notebook: The difficulties of covering North Korea
item.description: We discuss President Trump and Kim Jong Un's past negotiations and the difficulties of reporting on North Korea.

item.title: Inside the U.S. plan to detain immigrants in Latin America as bargaining chips in WWII
item.description: During World War II, the United States arrested hundreds of Japanese, German and Italian immigrants from Latin America and deported them to the U.S. where they lived in camps.

item.title: A rare German Bible found in Texas is now digitized
item.description: A 1983 routine cleaning at Boerne High School in Texas yielded a rare and precious find: a thick, ornate Bible wrapped in cloth and written in low German. Now it will soon be seen online.

item.title: Readers flock to fantasy and dark romance love stories
item.description: The romance genre continues to grow rapidly, as readers flock to fantasy and dark romance love stories.

item.title: Tariffs on fireworks may impact the 4th of July
item.description: Fans of fireworks may get a little less bang for their buck this Independence Day. Most fireworks are made in China, which means they're now facing an import tax of at least 30%.

item.title: The race to create AI applications is creating demand for training data in China
item.description: The race to create more powerful artificial intelligence applications has also created a huge demand in China for high quality training data.

item.title: Senate latest on tax and spending bill
item.description: Senate Republican leaders are still negotiating details of their massive tax and spending bill and moving toward a final vote sometime on Monday.

item.title: Prosecution and defense present closing arguments in trial of Sean Combs
item.description: NPR's Anastasia Tsioulcas discusses the closing arguments in the sex trafficking and racketeering trial of hip hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs.

item.title: What this term says about where the Supreme Court is headed
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Bloomberg News Supreme Court reporter Greg Stohr about what we've learned about the makeup and direction of the court from this term's rulings.
